newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee futures hold losses by close.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee futures hold losses by close.

text.p: London robusta coffee futures were hardly moved in the afternoon and prices ended Friday mostly lower on early origin selling activity, traders said.
Benchmark March slipped on early New York's sell-off but met strong support at $1,225 a tonne, life-of-contract low. It closed $2 down on the day at $1,227.
But volume was a thin 2,633 lots, dominated by AAs on the March contract.
At the close of business on Thursday, the January uncovered positions dropped by 1,612 lots to 4,190 as players rolled forward their positions into nearby March.
The March/March arbitrage between New York and London stayed wide at 60 U.S. cents a lb and traders said the level could remain at 50-60 cents for a while.
"People are pretty nervous of letting it go back below 50. A lot of people got their fingers burnt for going short of it," said one.
Traders thought a further London slide could be slowed with the market in oversold condition and funds holding short positions.
In other news, Ugandan coffee sales jumped to 985,000 60-kg bags in December from 353,000 in November, spurred by the removal of a coffee tax and high level of beginning stocks.
